channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023090354
item.description:
Report E-2023090354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of descaler (un3264) had been punctured by a pallet and that one of the inner poly one gallon jug had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at station 732 and was found at unload. Loose caps and leaked. It's placed in hazmat tote with bag DescribePack: Loose caps and leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It's placed in hazmat tote with bag

item.title: Report X-2023081791
item.description:
Report X-2023081791

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload during sort, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Package appears to be leaking due to bottom of container failing. This is possibly due to low quality outer packaging. Package also had no outer packaging, cap seals, or any bracing for the container or its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081646
item.description:
Report X-2023081646

  • City: EDMOND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA, leaking. Placed in tote. DescribePack: Package is undeclared and contains 4 isopropanol alcohol bottles. None have cap secures, one bottle leaked about 25% of its contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061351
item.description:
Report X-2023061351

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROX 45816 was found leaking in the Oklahoma City Flynn Yard by an FRA Inspector. The Inspector found a minor drip from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). EMI was dispatched, inspected PROX 45816 and determined the BOV cap was less than tool tight with residual product in the cap. The BNSF Contractor properly secured PROX 45816 to mitigate the release.
